Name: Flying Ba-bird used as pendant
Description: The outline was first cut out of gold foil and then strips of thin gold were soldered onto it, giving the shape of the body and the separate feathers, and were then inlaid with enamel. The underside of the bird, made of embossed gold foil, was soldered to the underneath. Near the wing tips on the underside, narrow strips of metal were used to make suspension loops.
